This patch is intended as a hotfix in the hopes that it can make it into the 1.0 release. Avoiding cleaning up running applications seems like the better solution in general, but is out of scope of this PR.

LGTM
ut added. @rxin

I think we should deprecate using `pyspark` to submit applications, and only allow it for the shell later. `spark-submit` works for Python applications too and it's better to keep this consistent with other languages. Can we maybe warn if you run `pyspark` on a `.py` file and say this will be deprecated later?

Another thing is that when you kill the Python/IPython shell the JVM still seems to be active. I tested this by running the shell, killing it and running it again. It complains that the Spark UI port is already taken.

btw - regarding the branch name - I don't think this was _too_ shitty of a default. I'd actually like to have this on by default if we can get it into working order, because otherwise users will only find out once it's too late that they are out of disk space :P

Jenkins, test this please (I think there are some code style issues here).
I see. I didn't realize we want to deprecate using `bin/pyspark` to run python files. We should probably keep the functionality for backwards compatibility and maybe add a warning as you suggest.
I've merged this. Thanks a lot!

Yeah, it wasn't super obvious but that's a good direction to go. I replaced pyspark with spark-submit in many of the docs on running applications, but I missed some.

In your code:

`sc.parallelize(1L to 2L,4).zip(sc.parallelize(11 to 12,4)).collect`
 =>
`Array[(Long, Int)] = Array((1,11), (2,12))` 
This is the right.
But
`sc.parallelize((1D to 2D).by(0.2),4).zip(sc.parallelize(11 to 12,4)).collect` 
=>
`Array((1.2,11), (1.8,12))`
 this result is not correct?
`(1D to 2D).by(0.2).zip(11 to 12)` => `Vector((1.0,11), (1.2,12))`

Refer to this link for build results: https://amplab.cs.berkeley.edu/jenkins/job/SparkPullRequestBuilder/15045/

I can see adding the repo as a convenience and env variable but does a vendor build profile belong here? (I don't think a cdh profile belongs in Spark either for example.) Does it help anyone else?

On a related note it's not ideal that there is a 'cdh4' assembly distributed specially from Spark. It makes some bit of sense if read as "a Hadoop 2 build that is customized with MR1" since that combo doesn't exist in an Apache distribution AFAIK.
Merged build triggered.
Merged build started.
Yeah, that pretty much has the same code. If it goes in I can close this.

Just a little miffed because it took some time to figure out why our executors suddenly started failing with jar-not-found errors :)

I'd prefer a full solution; last modified time runs into an issue if the executor lies dormant for a week. You might say, "that's unlikely", but I'd say, "it'll happen to someone, and they'll be a little miffed." The worker should have enough state to figure out which executors are currently active, though I'm not sure if the problem is made more difficult by multi-worker scenarios.
